meanings.definition: A feeling of dislike or aversion towards someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Her misliking of broccoli made dinner time a challenge.
meanings.sent2: His misliking for rainy days always put him in a bad mood.
meanings.sent3: The cat's misliking of the new toy was evident by its refusal to play with it.
meanings.sent4: The misliking towards public speaking felt like a heavy weight on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The misliking towards the taste of medicine was so strong, she couldn't even swallow it.

meanings.definition: The act of disliking or having a negative opinion about someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Their misliking of horror movies led them to choose a comedy instead.
meanings.sent2: The misliking towards the new policy was evident in the employees' reactions.
meanings.sent3: His misliking of early mornings was clear when he hit the snooze button multiple times.
meanings.sent4: The misliking towards change made it difficult for her to adapt to new situations.
meanings.sent5: The misliking towards spicy food was so strong, he avoided it at all costs.
